location.name: Khagrachhari
location.activity-description:
Agricultural production of female and male marginal and small farm households increased and diversified through IFM FFS in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT); and
Implementation of the CHT 1997 Peace Accord accelerated through further devolution of agricultural services to the Hill District Councils

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Number of Farmer Field School operational 2. Number of farmers of Para/Village Development Committee that have now access to improved knowledge on integrated farm management approach 3. Number of monitoring visits conducted by Government officers and Master trainers in the Farmer Field School - as a sign of acknowledgement by the government 4. Number of Farmers Field Days organized by Hill District Councils as a result of capacity development through UNDP from 2015 5. Number of Agricultural Planning Unit established and functional in 3 Hill District Councils - the activity sarted in 2015 6. Number of Farmer Facilitators that have skill to provide support to farmers 7. Number of new Local Service Providers that are now capable to support communities on livestock/poultry, nursery, fisheries sub-sectors from 2015

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) operates based on an Annual Action Plan in line with the Strategic Plan 2010-2015 2. Human Resources Service Rules based on government service rules finalized 3. Litigation strategy for National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) finalized and operational 4. Number of complaints brought to the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) 5. Number of laws passed or amended by Parliament to be made consistent with Bangladesh’s obligations under international conventions and treaties through National Human Rights Commission's advocacy efforts 6. Number of human rights reports submitted by National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) to United Nations human rights monitoring bodies (Treaty Bodies, Universal Periodic Review). 7. Percentage of people who have heard the term 'human rights' (Surveys conducted in 2011 and 2015) 8. Percentage of people in Bangladesh who are aware of the existence of the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) (Surveys conducted in 2011 and 2015)

Percentage of women’s participation in Village Court's decision making process

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Percentage of case disposal rate in the Pilot District Court 2. Progress made towards establishment of case management mechanism at Supreme Court [Scale 0 – 4; 1 for Supreme Court has established Case Management Committee (CMC) in District Court level and in the Supreme Court Level, 2 for Supreme Court has issued 6 points direction for speed up of case management process, 3 for Information Communication Technology (ICT) based cause list (case information) system established, 4 for Case Management Committee has been established and all of the committees are functional in conducting meetings regularly and sharing the meeting minutes and progress] 3. Number of Case Disposal Through Mediation increased in project pilot districts. 4. Number of Case Management Committees (CMC) established 5. Progress towards establishment of research and analysis unit in the Supreme Court [Scale 0 – 5; 1 for Special Committee for Judicial Reform Committee has approved the creation of a research and analysis unit, 2 for Supreme Court has finalized the organogram and identified the required number of staffs, 3 for Supreme Court sent an official letter to the Ministry of Law to create the positions for the research and analysis unit, 4 for the organogram of the research and analysis unit has been approved by the Ministry of Law, 5 for required staff positions have been created and filled] 6. Perceptions of court users on key indicators increased (service delivery, efficiency, trust) 7. Progress towards development of Strategic Plan of the Supreme Court of Bangladesh [Scale 0 – 3; 1 for Strategic Plan finalized, 2 for Strategic Plan approved by the Supreme Court, 3 for Strategic Plan approved by the Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs]

actual.comment: 1. TBA 2. TBA 3. TBA 4. TBA 5. TBA 6. TBA 7. TBA

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Progress made towards a centralized Human Resource unit in the Bangladesh Police with adequate functions [Scale from 0 to 5; 1 for Human Resource unit in Bangladesh Police exists, 2 for organogram for Human Resources unit approved, 3 for Human Resources unit is responsible for all recruitment with the exception of officers, who are recruited by Civil Service: 4 for Human Resources unit is made responsible for all training in Bangladesh Police, 5 for Human Resources unit has a budget specifically earmarked for the unit] 2. Progress made towards implementing an Information Management Strategy for Bangladesh Police [Scale from 0 to 4; 1 for Information Communication Technology Master Plan approved by the Bangladesh Police and Ministry of Home Affairs (MoHA), 2 for Organizational structures approved, 3 for key positions filled, 4 for governance structure and committee approved and operational] 3. Number of community members and police that benefit annually from project reform related training and capacity building interventions (strategic direction and organizational reform; human resource management and training; investigation, operations and prosecution; crime prevention and community policing; promoting gender sensitive policing; and/or information, communications and technology) 4. Percentage of police officers that are ‘very satisfied’ or ‘satisfied’ with the quality of crime scene management 5. Percentage of 35 targets in the National Community Policing Strategy that are at least partially achieved 6. Percentage of women in the police force 7. Number of victims that receive services from the Victim Support Centres per year 8. Percentage of police officers that believe there is adequate Information Communication Technology (ICT) equipment in the workplace

actual.comment: 1. 5 2. 3 3. 11574 (Community Members: 2146)(Police: 9428) 4. 80% [2013] 5. 85.7% (40%: Partially Achieved)(45.7%: Fully Achieved) 6. 5.26% 7. 1133 (Women: 334)(Girls: 657)(Boys: 142) 8. 62% (average of project supported and non-supported police)

1. 5 2. 3 [Mid-term] 3. 9472 (Community Members: 5170)(Police: 4302) [Mid-term] 4. TBA 5. 85.7% (40%: Partially Achieved)(45.7%: Fully Achieved) 6. 6.02% [Mid-term] 7. 1042 (Women: 373)(Girls: 561)(Boys: 108) [Mid-term] 8. 89% (average of project supported and non-supported police)

Percentage of 564 Union Parishads that operate based on a Five year plan as per administrative requirement of Union Parishads Act 2009 4. Percentage of 564 Union Parishads that have at least 1 woman representative participating in officially registered women Development Forum at the Upazila level 5. Percentage of 564 Union Parishads that have completed comprehensive development plans responding to local Millennium Development Goal assessments that will have also identified the needs of the most locally relevant vulnerable groups 6. Percentage of 564 Union Parishads that maintain and update a Cash book 7. Percentage of 564 Union Parishads that maintain and update an Asset register 8. Percentage of 564 Union Parishads that maintain and update a Tax assessment register 9. Percentage of 564 Union Parishads that maintain and update a Tax collection register 10. Percentage of 564 Union Parishads that maintain and update a Tax defaulter register
